p: In order to investigate the toxicity of the EOs, brine shrimp ( Artemia salina) bioassay was carried out according to Caputo et al. [ 49]. Brine shrimp’s eggs were purchased by a local pet shop, placed in a hatcher chamber containing artificial seawater, and incubated for 48 h at RT with continuous aeration and illumination. Stock solutions of M. pulegium EOs (0.01–1000 µg/mL) and K 2Cr 2O 7 (50 mg/mL) as a positive control, were prepared in DMSO. After that, 20 µL of each sample/control was seeded in a 24-well plate diluting 1:1000 v/v in artificial seawater (0.1% DMSO). Ten nauplii per well were added and incubated for 48 h in the same conditions reported above.
